nodes.description: Debezium is a platform for change data capture

nodes.description: Event Manager for the Platform Bileto

nodes.title: Event Manager Backend

nodes.title: Algolia
nodes.description: Algolia is a search engine that allows to search for events

edges.label: use revamp
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The organizer uses revamp to create an event at sympla DIY.

edges.label: saves event
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The revamp saves event to sympladb.

edges.label: syncs events from sympladb to debezium
edges.head: normal
edges.notes:
Debezium monitors the sympladb database by:
1. Reading the database transaction logs (WAL)
2. Capturing INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE operations
3. Converting the changes into events
4. Streaming these events in real-time
This enables reliable change data capture (CDC) from the database.

edges.label: syncs events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The debezium captures database changes and streams them to Amazon MSK (Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka) for event processing.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes:
Amazon MSK streams event information to Lambda through:
1. MSK topics containing event changes
2. Lambda function configured with MSK trigger
3. Event batches processed by Lambda consumer
This enables serverless processing of the event stream data.

edges.label: use event-manager-frontend
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The organizer uses event-manager-frontend to create an event at sympla Bileto.

edges.label: saves event
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The event-manager-frontend call event-manager-backend to save event.

edges.label: saves event
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The event-manager-backend saves event to bileto_db.

edges.label: syncs events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The bileto_db syncs events to sqs.

edges.label: sents event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The sqs-event-streaming sents event information meta information to lambda.

edges.label:
saves event information and gets tags 
information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The lambda-event-streaming saves event information to dynamo-db and gets tags information from dynamo-db.

edges.label: get more information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes:
The lambda-event-streaming gets more information from sympladb to complement event information.
1. Get event information
2. Get organizer information
3. Get event information from campaign

edges.label: get more information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes:
The lambda-event-streaming gets more information from bileto_db to complement event information.
1. Get event information
2. Get organizer information

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The lambda-event-streaming sends event information to sqs-classifier.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The sqs-classifier sends event information to lambda-worker-classifier.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The lambda-worker-classifier sends event information to sqs-event-score.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The lambda-worker-classifier sends event information to sqs-creator-classifier.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The lambda-worker-classifier sends event information to sqs-feature-event.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The sqs-event-score sends event information to lambda-event-score.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The lambda-event-score sends event information to sqs-search-indexer.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The sqs-search-indexer sends event information to lambda-search-indexer.

edges.label: saves event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The lambda-search-indexer saves public event information to opensearch.

edges.label: saves event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The lambda-search-indexer saves private event information to elasticsearch.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The lambda-search-indexer sends event information to sqs-algolia-search-indexer.

edges.label: sends event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The sqs-algolia-search-indexer sends event information to algolia-search-indexer.

edges.label: saves event information
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The algolia-search-indexer saves public event information to algolia.

usecase-discovery-home-poc-algolia.description: This use case illustrates how buyers discover and search for events using the Algolia search engine integration in our proof-of-concept home page implementation.
usecase-discovery-home-poc-algolia.title: [UseCase] [Level 2] Algolia-Powered Event Discovery and Search

nodes.title: Buyer
nodes.description: Person that discovers events, purchases tickets, and attends them using digital tickets.

nodes.title: Discovery Next
nodes.description: Discovery Next is a web application buyers use to find events

nodes.title: Algolia
nodes.description: Algolia is a search engine that allows to search for events

edges.label: searches for products
edges.head: normal
edges.notes:
The buyer searches for products in the web application:
1. Via search bar
2. Via search suggestions when scrolling down
3. Via search suggestions when typing

edges.label: makes a API call to algolia
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The discovery service makes a API call to the algolia through krakend.

edges.label: makes a API call to algolia
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The krakend makes a API call to the algolia.

edges.label: returns the events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The algolia returns the events to the krakend.

edges.label: returns the events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The krakend returns the events to the discovery service.

edges.label: returns the events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The discovery service returns the events to the buyer.

usecase-discovery-home-search.description: This use case illustrates how buyers search for and discover events through the Sympla home page, including the search request flow, data retrieval process, and response handling across the discovery system components.
usecase-discovery-home-search.title: [UseCase] [Level 2] Home Page Event Discovery Flow

nodes.title: Apollo Server
nodes.description: Apollo Server is a web application that allows buyers to find events

edges.label: searches for products
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The buyer searches for products in the web application.

edges.label: make a API call
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The discovery service makes a API call to the Apollo server.

edges.label:
use this lambda function as a proxy to 
get events from elasticsearch
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The Apollo server calls a lambda function to get eventos from elasticsearch.

edges.label:
use this lambda function to get access 
to elasticsearch
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The BFF events calls a lambda function to get eventos from elasticsearch.

edges.label: makes a query to elasticsearch
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The search events calls a lambda function to get eventos from elasticsearch.

edges.label: returns the events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The opensearch returns the events to the search events.

edges.label: returns the events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The search events returns the events to the BFF events.

edges.label: returns the events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The BFF events returns the events to the Apollo server.

edges.label: returns the events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The Apollo server returns the events to the white-lion.

edges.label: returns the events
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The white-lion returns the events to the buyer.

usecase-discovery-simple-cms.description: This use case illustrates how the Marketing SEO staff manages content on the Discovery system through various Google Sheets. It demonstrates the workflow for configuring home page banners, indexing events in Bileto landing pages, reindexing events, and customizing the home page, with all data being stored in DynamoDB.
usecase-discovery-simple-cms.title: [UseCase] [Level 2] Discovery CMS

usecase-general-report-unauthorized-purc.description: This use case describes the process of reporting an unauthorized purchase through a web application.
usecase-general-report-unauthorized-purc.title: [UseCase] Report Unauthorized Purchase

nodes.title: Buyer
nodes.description: Person that discovers events, purchases tickets, and attends them using digital tickets.

edges.label: reports unauthorized purchase
edges.head: normal
edges.notes:
The buyer reports an unauthorized purchase by:
1. Accessing the report form
2. Providing Order Number
3. Providing Email
4. Submitting the form

edges.label: submits form data
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The frontend submits the form data to the backend API route (/api/report).

edges.label: confirms data storage
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: Google Sheets API confirms the successful storage of the report data.

edges.label: displays confirmation message
edges.head: normal
edges.notes: The frontend displays a confirmation message to the buyer that their report has been submitted successfully.
